intro: Pycnarrhena papuana, commonly known as the Papuan pycnarrhena, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Papua, Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
